content:
Officials from the city labor department have indicated that a pilot program for a four-day work week may be introduced for certain IT companies. The proposal is reportedly under discussion with industry associations and worker unions.

Some companies have already experimented with reduced working hours and reported improvements in employee satisfaction. However, productivity outcomes have varied depending on the type of work and company policies.

Government representatives have not yet released formal documentation, and no timeline has been confirmed. Experts say that while such programs can improve work-life balance, implementation challenges remain, especially for service-based industries.

Until an official announcement is made, the proposal remains under consideration and may undergo further revisions.
